item.description:
Located in Inman Square Cambridge, the Ryles Jazz Club's line-up of great local Jazz musicians, combined with its very reasonable prices for music and food, have made it one of the premiere Jazz venues in the Boston area for more than 30 years.

Lance Martin (Berklee College of Music) is a superb and very animated flute player who gyrates around the stage as he plays, always putting on a great show.

Joining Lance is Jonathan Singleton (Berklee), Director of the celebrated Mystic Chorale, whose piano interpretations always delight. Rounding out the group is Zeke Martin on drums. As a special treat, they'll be joined by a surprise guest vocalist.

For dinner, we'll dine at 7pm at the S&S Restaurant very near Ryles. They don't accept reservations for less than 8 people, so we'll all meet there at 7pm. Also, Ryles tells me that reservations are unnecessary as long as we get there somewhat before 9pm, so dining at 7pm should be just right.

NOTE: The S&S Restaurant has a FREE parking lot on Hampshire Street at the corner of Prospect Street.
item.name: The Lance Martin Band @ Ryles
